Landing.heroTitle: Automate Resume Screening with AI Intelligence
Landing.heroDescription: Stop reading thousands of PDFs. Let our AI agents parse, rank, and analyze candidates in seconds with human-level understanding.
Landing.explainableAIDesc: Transparent match scores. See exactly why a candidate gets a 92% with detailed positive and negative skill breakdowns.
Landing.smartJobParsingDesc: Paste raw text and let our AI instantly extract skills, requirements, and automatically fill out your job creation forms.
Landing.contextualAIEmailsDesc: Auto-generate highly personalized interview invites or polite rejections based on the candidate's exact profile.
Landing.interactiveKanbanDesc: Manage your hiring pipeline visually. Drag and drop candidates through custom stages with instant UI updates.
Landing.teamManagementDesc: Collaborate seamlessly. Manage recruiter roles, permissions, and access levels with an intuitive workspace interface.
Landing.smartPDFWorkspaceDesc: Review resumes comfortably day or night. Our custom viewer features seamless dark mode inversion for PDF files.

InterviewPrep.title: Interview Guide
InterviewPrep.description: AI-generated questions based on candidate's weak points and missing skills.
InterviewPrep.loadingDesc: Analyzing resume gaps and generating technical challenges...

card.expected: What to look for in the answer

q1.title: Explain how you would diagnose a memory leak in a Node.js production application without stopping the process.
q1.context: Candidate lacks specific experience with high-load Node.js debugging.
q1.expected: Look for mention of heap snapshots, Chrome DevTools protocol, or using 'heapdump'/'v8-profiler'. A good answer should explain how to analyze the snapshot comparison to find detached DOM nodes or growing closures.

q2.title: Describe a scenario where you would choose eventual consistency over strong consistency in a distributed system.
q2.expected: Candidate should discuss CAP theorem trade-offs. Example: Social media feed (eventual) vs. Bank transaction (strong). Key concepts: Availability and Partition Tolerance vs. Consistency.

q3.title: How does the React Fiber reconciliation algorithm work, and how does it enable features like Time Slicing?
q3.context: Deep React internals not mentioned in skills.
q3.expected: Mentions splitting work into chunks, 'requestIdleCallback' (or scheduler), and the ability to pause/abort rendering work. Shows understanding of the render vs. commit phases.

q4.title: What are the security implications of using JWTs for session management compared to server-side sessions?
q4.context: Security best practices missing from project descriptions.
q4.expected: Discussion on token invalidation (blacklisting), storage risks (XSS in localStorage vs CSRF in HttpOnly cookies), and the inability to instantly revoke access without short expiry times.

q5.title: Design a rate-limiting strategy for a public API that handles burst traffic.
q5.expected: Mentions algorithms like Token Bucket or Leaky Bucket. Discusses distributed state (Redis/Memcached) for tracking counts across multiple server instances.

q1.title: What is the difference between specificty in CSS and how is it calculated?
q1.expected: Explanation of the weighting system: Inline styles > IDs > Classes > Elements. Should mention how `!important` overrides this.

q2.title: Explain the concept of closures in JavaScript with a practical example.
q2.expected: A specific example showing a function retaining access to variables from its outer scope even after the outer function has returned.

q3.title: What are the key differences between SQL and NoSQL databases?
q3.expected: Structured vs. Unstructured data, Schema scaling (Vertical vs. Horizontal), and ACID properties (SQL) vs. BASE (NoSQL).

q4.title: How does the browser event loop work?
q4.expected: Explanation of Call Stack, Web APIs, Callback Queue, and Microtask Queue. Correct order of execution (Sync -> Microtasks -> Macrotasks).

q5.title: What is the purpose of the 'key' prop in React lists?
q5.expected: It helps React identify which items have changed, are added, or are removed, optimizing the reconciliation process and preventing bugs with component state.

Outreach.description: Customize the AI-generated email before sending.

reasoning.prefix: AI generated this based on the profile:

mockReason.rejection: Lack of specific experience matching job requirements.
mockReason.invitation: Strong match with required skills and experience.

bulk.title: Review Individual AI Rejections
bulk.description: AI has drafted unique reasons for each candidate to ensure a personalized touch.
